reviews.review_msg: The worst professor that I have had at SFU so far. He is condescending and makes no sense most of the time. When I would go up to him to ask him a question, he would put his face really close to mine and say "look into my eyes" and make me feel incredibly uncomfortable before responding. AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COSTS.

A very nice man, but impossibly boring and extremely unclear. The lectures were dry and hard to follow, and he often literally just read off the lecture slides. Most frustratingly, nothing in the class was really explained or elaborated on in any way, leading to everything being total rote memorization that doesn't even make sense. Avoid.

The most boring professor I have ever met. He constantly goes off-topic and takes forever to explain the material. Sometimes, he runs over time (even after a 3 hour class) and rushes his last points as everyone is leaving. The only reason he is rated so high is because his exams are easy multiple choice and you can just memorize the slides to pass.

Kind-hearted, wholesome man but a poor lecturer. The two assignments are online and absolutely useless for the exam. You need to be in class to understand what he's trying to teach but get read to teach yourself everything. His teaching style is not great which made this class hard. Got away with guessing 70% of answers on exams and somehow passed.

Iouri replies every e-mail from students and he will put all the questions in a document then uploads it to the canvas so that we can go over those questions before midterms or final. This is good. I won't take his courses anymore because his lecture is NOT GOOD. It will make you suffer to some extent.

He's a really nice guy and it's clear he's passionate about what he's teaching but boy is he dull. During course selection season his rating here went from its current 3.2 to a 4.2, and then back down. Additionally in his syllabus and online he spells his name as Iouri Pankrats (unable to find him here). I can't help but be suspicious of this.
His lectures are very clear and I like how he defines everything. Lectures can get a little off topic but I think his stories help keep people interested.

He's frustrating. Clearly knows what he's talking about, and clearly passionate about his material given he's been teaching this course for so long, but his poor English skills translate into both his lectures and his notes, which make them difficult to decipher. He also frequently ignores students who try to answer his questions or ask any too.
